It is native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in low-water environments. Hoffmannia kirkbridei is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
